x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: During conflicts, people lose access to basic needs like food, shelter, and clothing. Donations are often uncoordinated, with no clear visibility of where help is needed most. There’s a need for a centralised, transparent system to connect donors, NGOs, and victims efficiently.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: Relief Connect: Empowering Communities to Support War Victims
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Relief Connect will be a ServiceNow-based donation management platform that:

  • Lets users donate food, clothes, essentials, or money through a Service Portal.

  • Matches donations with verified NGO requests using AI workflows.

  • Tracks logistics and delivery status in real-time.

  • Displays impact metrics via dashboards and maps.

ServiceNow products or capabilities that would be used are mentioned below

  • App Engine / Studio - Scoped app build

  • Service Portal - Donation submission interface

  • Flow Designer & IntegrationHub - Automations and logistics APIs

  • Performance Analytics - Impact dashboards

  • Now Assist (AI) - Smart donation matching

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • IntegrationHub spokes for payments (PayPal/Stripe) and logistics (FedEx/DHL)

  • Geolocation API for mapping

  • Document Management for donation receipts

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Data security and privacy for donors/recipients

  • Verification of NGO authenticity

  • API integration complexity

  • Scalability during high traffic periods
